page.title: 01West Carr & Sandtoft
page.content: The 'West Carr' area lies immediately west of the village of Belton. It is a very flat extensive area of arable farmland, the only residents being those in isolated farmsteads. The flat nature of the land and the characteristic profusion of drianage ditches is attributable to its reclamation from marchland by the Dutch engineer Vermuyden in the early 17th century. Two notable features of this relatively uniform area are 1) Lindholme lake ( a thriving privately owned trout fishery) 2) Sandtoft Aerodrome (an ex-World War 2 Bomber training base which is now the home of Sandtoft Air Services Ltd., a small private firm who carry out aircraft repair work and offer flying lessons as part of their service.
